title: Why did the Vikings first get famous in the Middle Ages but nobody heard of them in antiquity? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Viking” is an occupation, not an ethnicity. And the occupation could not exist until the relevant tools had been invented. In the case of Vikings, it was the longship—a special construction that was very seaworthy, yet well adapted for fast coastal raids. Also, the proper social and economic circumstances had to exist; the ship type had been around for a while when an expanding population in Scandinavia made it necessary to go abroad to find resources, while there was a high demand for goods and slaves around the Mediterranean. It’s a bit like asking why no one had heard of guitar players in antiquity: no one had yet constructed a guitar.

Because they were known under different names in antiquity. People in antiquity have certainly heard of the Vandals. They were described by Tacitus as living in Central/Eastern Europe but their own history said that they originated in Scandinavia. The people they left behind became the Vikings.
